segment.source: The Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) server infrastructure depends on a set of server features that can be installed on one or more server computers, based on the requirements of the enterprise.
segment.target: The Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) server infrastructure depends on a set of server features that can be installed on one or more server computers, based on the requirements of the enterprise.

segment.source: If you are installing Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with the Configuration Manager topology, see Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: If you are installing Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with the Configuration Manager topology, see Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Installations of Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring on a single server are recommended only for test environments.
segment.target: Installations of Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring on a single server are recommended only for test environments.

segment.source: The infrastructure for an MBAM Server deployment includes the following features:
segment.target: The infrastructure for an MBAM Server deployment includes the following features:

segment.source: MBAM Server databases and features can be installed in different configurations, depending on your scalability requirements.
segment.target: MBAM Server databases and features can be installed in different configurations, depending on your scalability requirements.

segment.source: All MBAM Server features can be installed on a single server or distributed across multiple servers.
segment.target: All MBAM Server features can be installed on a single server or distributed across multiple servers.

segment.source: We recommend that you use a two-server configuration for production environments, although configurations of two to four servers can also be used, depending on your computing requirements.
segment.target: We recommend that you use a two-server configuration for production environments, although configurations of two to four servers can also be used, depending on your computing requirements.

segment.source: Each MBAM feature has specific prerequisites.
segment.target: Each MBAM feature has specific prerequisites.

segment.source: For a full list of server feature prerequisites and hardware and software requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For a full list of server feature prerequisites and hardware and software requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: In addition to the server-related MBAM features, the Server Setup application includes an MBAM Group Policy template.
segment.target: In addition to the server-related MBAM features, the Server Setup application includes an MBAM Group Policy template.

segment.source: The template contains Group Policy Object (GPO) settings that you configure to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption in the enterprise.
segment.target: The template contains Group Policy Object (GPO) settings that you configure to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption in the enterprise.

segment.source: You can install this template on any computer that can run the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM).
segment.target: You can install this template on any computer that can run the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM).

segment.source: As you plan the MBAM Server deployment, consider that BitLocker recovery keys in MBAM are intended for single use only, after which recovery keys expire.
segment.target: As you plan the MBAM Server deployment, consider that BitLocker recovery keys in MBAM are intended for single use only, after which recovery keys expire.

segment.source: In order for the keys to expire after use, they must be retrieved through the Help Desk Portal or the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: In order for the keys to expire after use, they must be retrieved through the Help Desk Portal or the Self-Service Portal.
